instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.R7005: What is R7005? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging/starting
threads.message:
i think i fixed this once before a year ago but it's back again

charger light does turn green but computer won't start, no orange, and no charging

i've followed the 16.8V in to

<TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR>
pin 4 1.7 V
pin 5 16.8V
pin 1-3 1.3V

is <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR> bad or it is the ISL
or i guess i should check the fuse, will do in a few

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging/starting
threads.message: check value for <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> and resistance between pins 17-18 and 27-28 from <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>, report values......

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging/starting
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> reading 20.2 ohm
between 17&18 2.5 ohms
between 27-28 20.3 ohms

threads.message: So short on PPBUS.... Inject voltage to see what heats up.
